material.mattext: What is the primary characteristic of analog voice communication?
Which of the following is a common medium for analog voice communication?
What does the term "modulation" refer to in analog communication?
Varying a signal's properties to encode information
Which type of modulation is used to vary the amplitude of the carrier signal?
Which modulation technique varies the frequency of the carrier signal?
Which device converts analog voice signals into electrical signals?
What does a demodulator do in analog communication?
Extracts the original information signal from the modulated carrier
Which type of noise affects analog signals by adding random variations?
What is the primary disadvantage of analog communication compared to digital?
Susceptibility to noise and signal degradation
Which frequency range is typically used for human voice communication?
What is the function of a telephone hybrid circuit?
Which of the following is an example of an analog communication device?
What is the role of an amplifier in analog voice communication?
Increases the strength of the signal
Which of the following can cause signal attenuation in analog communication?
What does the term "frequency response" refer to in analog communication?
The range of frequencies that a system can transmit or receive
Which component is used to filter out unwanted frequencies in an analog system?
What is the primary purpose of an equalizer in analog communication?
Adjust the balance of frequencies in a signal
Which type of modulation is used in FM radio broadcasting?
What does the term "signal-to-noise ratio" refer to?
The ratio of the strength of the signal to the level of background noise
Which of the following is a disadvantage of Frequency Modulation (FM)?
What is the primary use of a modulator in analog communication?
Encode information onto a carrier signal
Which term describes the variation in the phase of a carrier signal to encode information?
Which type of signal is used in traditional landline telephony?
What is the effect of signal attenuation over long distances?
Which term describes the conversion of voice signals into electrical signals?
Which component is essential for transmitting analog signals over long distances?
What is a key benefit of using Frequency Modulation (FM) for voice communication?
Which term describes the process of boosting a weak analog signal?
What is the primary purpose of a noise filter in analog communication?
Remove unwanted noise from the signal
Which component converts electrical signals back into sound waves? Next, let's create the MCQs for Week 3: Digital Voice Communication.
